name: brian-skinner
body:
# Code Samples If you're interested in seeing examples of code that I've written, here are links to projects that I've worked on over the years. | Year | Languages | Tools | Project | Details | # of Files | |:----:|:--------- |:----- |:------- |:------- |:---- | | 2011 | **Java** | Google App Engine,
JSP,
Eclipse,
Mercurial,
XML, CSV| Translation workflow tool | This is a small open source project spun off from my work at Google. I did the design and most of the coding, with contributions from a volunteer I recruited.
+ [project home](http://code.google.com/p/translation-workflow/)
+ [documentation](http://code.google.com/p/translation-workflow/w/list)
+ [unit tests](http://code.google.com/p/translation-workflow/source/browse/#hg%2Ftests%2Fcom%2Fgoogle%2Fdotorg%2Ftranslation_workflow%253Fstate%253Dclosed)
+ [source](http://code.google.com/p/translation-workflow/source/browse/#hg%2Fsrc%2Fcom%2Fgoogle%2Fdotorg%2Ftranslation_workflow) | 50-ish | | 2008 | **Python**,
**JavaScript** | Google App Engine,
Dojo,
CSS | Chemical inventory database | This is a little demo of a hypothetical online database for tracking a lab's chemical inventory. I wrote this as part of a job interview for a drug development company.
+ [demo](http://cddapp.appspot.com/)
+ [unit tests & source](http://cddapp.appspot.com/developer/planning) | 20-ish | | 2008 | **Python**,
**JavaScript** | Django,
Google App Engine,
Subversion | OpenRecord wiki 2008 | This is a quick and dirty experiment I did when I was teaching myself Python, App Engine, and Django.
+ [unit tests](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/openrecord/redux/trunk/openrecord/test/)
+ [Python source](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/openrecord/redux/trunk/openrecord/app/)
+ [JavaScript source](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/openrecord/redux/trunk/openrecord/static/dorp/) | 30-ish | | 2007 | **JavaScript** | Dojo,
Subversion | [CSV](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values) file reader | + [unit tests](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/src/dojox/trunk/data/tests/stores/CsvStore.js)
+ [source](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/src/dojox/trunk/data/CsvStore.js) | 2 | | 2007 | **JavaScript** | Dojo,
Subversion | [UUID](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier) utilities | + [unit tests](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/src/dojox/trunk/uuid/tests/)
+ [source](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/src/dojox/trunk/uuid/) | 6 | | 2007 | **JavaScript** | Dojo,
CSS,
Subversion| OpenRecord wiki | This was a group project, with a half dozen different people who contributed. I was the project lead and wrote much of the code.
+ [project home](http://openrecord.org/)
+ [screencast](http://openrecord.org/screencast/2006-02-21/OpenRecord.html)
+ [unit tests](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/openrecord/classic/trunk/tests/)
+ [source](http://svn.dojotoolkit.org/openrecord/classic/trunk/source/) | 120-ish | | 2004 | **JavaScript** | CSS | Pivot-table demo | A simple demo I wrote when I was first teaching myself JavaScript.
+ [source](http://gumption.org/2004/pivot_table/)
+ [demo](http://gumption.org/2004/pivot_table/test_page.html) | 8 | | 2004 | **JavaScript** | CSS | Boardgame dice roller | A toy I wrote to teach myself JavaScript.
+ [source](http://gumption.org/2004/dice/)
+ [demo](http://gumption.org/2004/dice/dicemachine.html) | 3 | # Little Hacks These next ones aren't real programming projects, just little hacks to get things done, but they may serve as examples of attempts at quick-and-dirty problem solving. | Year | Languages | Tools | Project | Details | # of Files | |:----:|:--------- |:----- |:------- |:------- |:---- | | 2013 | **HTML & CSS** | | Photo viewer | Done using only HTML and CSS, **without** JavaScript.
+ [html source](http://www.vollershouse.org/photos.html)
+ [css source](http://www.vollershouse.org/style.css) | 2 | | 2013 | **HTML & CSS** | | House floorplan | Just for fun, vector graphics done only using only HTML and CSS, **without** canvas or SVG.
+ [html source](http://www.vollershouse.org/floorplan.html)
+ [css source](http://www.vollershouse.org/style.css) | 2 | | 2006 | **JavaScript** | MediaWiki | Bar charts | A simple MediaWiki hack to display some data in bar charts
+ [source](http://www.charityscorecard.org/wiki/CharityScorecard:Organization_scorecard.js) | 1 | | 2006 | **JavaScript** | MediaWiki | Interactive bar charts | A MediaWiki hack that updates bar chart data based on user choices
+ [source](http://www.charityscorecard.org/wiki/CharityScorecard:Custom_scorecard.js) | 1 | | 2006 | **JavaScript** | MediaWiki | Disclosure links | A MediaWiki hack for toggling a set of show/hide links all at once
+ [source](http://www.charityscorecard.org/wiki/CharityScorecard:Show_more.js) | 1 |
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
